q:
Based on the given information, determine the day on which Anna was born:

1. Patrick is 53 weeks older than Pearl.
2. Pearl is 462 days older than Anna.
3. Patrick was born on Monday.
Which of the following options is not a Leap Year?

Consider the information given below:

1. Ben remembers that his father's birthday comes after April 10 and before April 20.
2. His brother Bob remembers that his father's birthday comes after April 5 and before April 12.

Now, which of the following statements is correct with respect to the information given above?


Statements

  1. Their father's birthday is on April 14
     
  2. Their father's birthday is on April 11
     
  3. Their father's birthday is on April 15
     
  4. Their father's birthday is on April 5

In the year 2004, Maria celebrated her birthday on Monday. Which year will be the first after 2004, when Maria will celebrate her birthday on Saturday?
Note: Maria was not born in the months of January or February.

Bob and Alice celebrated their anniversary together on 26th August 1993, Thursday. Which of the following deductions are valid in the given scenario?

I. They will be celebrating their anniversary on the same day(Thursday) again in 2000.
II. They will be celebrating their anniversary on the same day(Thursday) again in 1999.
What is the ratio of Mondays and Wednesdays between 31 July 2018(Tuesday) to 30 August 2018?

If the second Tuesday and every Saturday is a holiday then which of the following deductions are valid?

A. There will be 25 working days in a month of 30 days beginning on a Tuesday.
B. There will be 5 non-working days in a month of 30 days beginning on a Tuesday.

Read the below given statements carefully and choose the most appropriate option:
Statement 1: The year 1896 is a leap year.
Statement 2: The year 1908 has the exact same calendar as the year 2020.

a.option: Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is false
Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is true
Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is true
Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is false

q: Bob celebrated his birthday on 15th September 1985, that is on Sunday. In which year will he celebrate his next birthday on the same day?

Bob buys a bike on 15th March 2016 (Tuesday). He is asked to bring the bike for servicing after 30 months.
Determine the day of the week on which the bike needs to be brought in for servicing.
Note: All months have 30 days.
If in 2003, May 17th was a Saturday, then how many Fridays and Sundays were there in that month?
If 8th February 2013 is a Friday, then what day will it be on 8th February 2026?
On what dates of March 2008, did Thursday fall?
What day will the last day of April be if four days after April 14th is a Monday?
If June 22, 1987, was a Thursday, then what was the day on November 28, 1991?

Read the following statements carefully and choose the most appropriate option.
1. Assuming that today is Thursday, Tuesday is likely to occur after 1 non-leap year and 82 days.
2. It is the same day on 18th September 1947 and 18th March 1948

a.option: Statement 1 is true but Statement 2 is not true
Statement 1 is not true but Statement 2 is true
Statement 1 is not true and Statement 2 is true
Statement 1 is not true and Statement 2 is not true

q:
Suppose today is Monday and Alice's birthday is the day after tomorrow. On the same day next week, Alice and her friends decide to go to a Halloween party. Which of the following statements is correct with respect to the given context?


Statements

  1. The following day of the Halloween party will be Saturday
     
  2. The following day of the Halloween party will be Wednesday
     
  3. The following day of the Halloween party will be Friday
     
  4. The following day of the Halloween party will be Thursday

A junior superintendent received a letter at noon on a particular day. The next day he passed the letter to the senior superintendent, who was absent that day.
The senior superintendent sent the same letter to his super senior at five in the evening the day after that. On the same day, that is Friday, the office manager dispatched it.
On which day did the junior superintendent received the letter?
If Bob was born on 14 January 1992 (Tuesday), what day of the week will it be on his 18th birthday?

Alice is celebrating her birthday on Friday in the year 2016. If her birthday doesn't fall on January or February, then which of these deductions are valid?

1. In 2020, Mona will celebrate her birthday on Wednesday.
2. In 2019, Mona will celebrate her birthday on Sunday.

Read the following statements carefully and choose the most appropriate option.

A. March 1, 2004 was a Friday and March 1, 2005 was a Sunday.
B. If the first day of the year (other than leap year) was Monday, then Monday was the last day.

a.option: Statement A is true but Statement B is not true
Statement A is not true but Statement B is true
Statement A is not true and Statement B is true
Statement A is not true and Statement B is not true

q: Anthony was born on 16th July 1985, which was a Tuesday. In which year, will his birthday fall on Saturday?
Bob started working on 20 October, 2016 and turned 23 after 15 days. Since it was Friday, he planned a 2 day vacation to celebrate his 23rd birthday. Which day was Bob born?
Bob was born on 29th February 2016, which happened to be a wednesday. If he lives till the year 2099, then how many birthdays would he celebrate on a wednesday?
What will be the immediate next year to 1986 with the same calendar as the year 1986?
Bob was born on April 20, 1992. His friend Ben was born 10 days before Bob. If the Indian Republic day falls on Sunday in that year, then on which day was Ben born?

There are five managers A, B, C, D, E in a company. Consider the statements given alongside the managers.

Determine the incorrect deductions made from the given statements.

  1. The company is open five days a week.
  2. In a day only two managers can be present in the company.
  3. No manager can come to the company on consecutive days.
  4. Also, no same pair of managers can come twice a week.
  5. A and C go to the company on the 3rd day.
  6. B and E go on the 4th day.
  7. C and B go to the company on the 1st and 2nd day, respectively.

a.option: C works on1st and 3rd day of the week.
D and A work on 5th day of the week.
B and C works on first days of week.
D works on 2nd and 5th day of the week
